DataElement.preferredName: Patient Concomitant Or Prior Invasive Malignant Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating that a patient meets the eligibility criteria for participation in a clinical trial regarding concomitant or prior invasive malignancies.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Concomitant Or Prior Invasive Malignant Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Earlier in time or order._Cancer that has spread beyond the layer of tissue in which it developed and is growing into surrounding, healthy tissues._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Concomitant Or Prior Invasive Malignant Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Earlier in time or order.:Cancer that has spread beyond the layer of tissue in which it developed and is growing into surrounding, healthy tissues.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Cancer that has spread beyond the layer of tissue in which it developed and is growing into surrounding, healthy tissues.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a concomita
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a concomitant or prior invasive malignancy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have another concurrent active invasive malignancy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a concomitant or prior invasive malignancies within the past 3 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had concurrent active malignancies for greater than or equal to 2 years prior to treatment start with the exception of currently treated basal cell or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin, or carcinoma in-situ of the cervix or breast?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a concurrent active malignancy other than treated non-melanoma skin cancers or in situ neoplasm?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have history of prior invasive colon malignancy, regardless of disease-free interval?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had prior invasive malignancy (other than non-melanomatous skin cancer), within the last 3 years

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had prior invasive malignancy (except non-melanomatous skin cancer) unless disease free for a minimum of 2 years

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had prior invasive malignancy (except non-melanomatous skin cancer, cervical cancer in situ and melanoma in situ) unless disease free for a minimum of 2 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of prior invasive colon malignancy, regardless of disease-free interval?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a concurrent malignancy that is progressing or requires active treatment?
